oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Interview and performance - Lee Ann Womack - 2017-09-16
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Interview with and performances by Lee Ann Womack from the Ford Theater at the Country Music Hall of Fame and Museum on September 16, 2017. Hosted by Peter Cooper. Includes selected recorded audio. Presented in partnership with the Americana Music Association.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Lee Ann Womack; Peter Cooper'
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Walk-in music / (15:24) Opening comments by Peter Cooper and introduction of Danna Strong / (15:58) Dana Strong comments / (16:45) Introduction of Lee Ann Womack / (19:25) Opening comments by Lee Ann / (19:36) Performs End Of The End Of The World (Lex Price on guitar) / (22:07) Lee Ann talks about her background and when she began singing / (23:14) Lee Ann talks about recording her latest album in Houston, Texas / (25:48) Talk about feeling the need to leave Nashville to record and her dream of making records / (27:25) Talks about having the freedom to record songs that she wants to versus what she was expected to record / (28:35) Talks about the song I Hope You Dance / (29:36) Talks about the song Take The Devil Out Of Me / (30:44) Plays recording of Take The Devil Out Of Me / (32:32) Lee Ann talks about relying on people she hires to advise her in the studio / (33:30) Talk about couples in the music business and working with her husband Frank Liddell /

(35:09) Talks about the Americana genre and being free to do what she does / (36:13) Talks about the song All The Trouble / (37:18) Plays recording of the song All The Trouble / (43:16) Talks about the recording of the previous song and Glenn Worf / (43:46) Talks about Adam Wright / (45:01) Talks about the difference between finding songs to record now and ten years ago / (46:53) Talks about having her own songs on her album / (47:30) Talks about her writing process / (48:30) Talks about listening to music at home and expanding her musical input / (49:17) Talks about how she feels about a song after she's written it and why Frank wanted her to write more for this record / (50:07) Talk about Charlie Worsham and recording with Frank / (50:33) Talks about how she feels about traveling / (51:26) Talks about decisions she's made that helped her career / (52:45) Talks about A&R meetings where they talk about songs and her relationship with her record label /
